memo:
BILL NUMBER:S1795

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the criminal procedure law, in relation to requiring HIV
related testing in certain cases

PURPOSE OR GENERAL IDEA OF BILL:
Allows sex offense victims to request
that indicted sex offenders submit to HIV testing anytime between
indictment and sentencing.

SUMMARY OF SPECIFIC PROVISIONS:
Section 1: Amends paragraph (b) of subdivision 1 of section 390.15 of
the criminal procedure law, to include indicted defendants in the
group of eligible sex offenders subject to HIV testing at the request
of their alleged victim. Amends subdivision 2 of section 390.15 of
the criminal procedure law, as added by chapter 76 of the laws of
1995 to allow such request to be made at any time after indictment
and before sentencing.

JUSTIFICATION:
The successful criminal prosecution of a sex crime can take months or
even years, but victims need to embark upon an HIV treatment regimen
very quickly to reduce the chances of an infection. This measure will
allow victims to make necessary medical treatment decisions as
quickly as possible, while still protecting the defendant's right to
privacy until a criminal investigation is completed and an indictment
has been issued.

PRIOR LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
2006:    S.7608 - Referred to Crime Victims, Crime & Protection
2008:    S.2296 - Referred to Crime Victims, Crime & Protection
2009/10: S.1908 - Referred to Codes Committee

FISCAL IMPLICATION:
None to the state.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
Immediately.
